title: How to Make Gluten Free Jam Tarts

steps.headline: Add the ingredients to a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Place the flour, xanthan gum, and caster sugar in.

steps.headline: Cut the margarine into the mixture.
steps.description: Cut and mix until you achieve a breadcrumb consistency.

steps.headline: Drizzle the cold water in.
steps.description: Add about a tablespoon at a time, until the mixture pulls together as a dough.

steps.headline: Create a ball.
steps.description: Use your fingertips to pull everything together and form a ball.

steps.headline: Knead the dough lightly.
steps.description: Knead until the mixture feels elastic and smooth.

steps.headline: Sandwich the dough with clingfilm.
steps.description: Lay the pastry between two large layers of clingfilm and roll the pastry out to about 3mm thick.

steps.headline: Cut out the tarts.
steps.description: Peel the top clingfilm and cut out as many tarts as you can with a circular pastry cutter.

steps.headline: Add the dough to a tart tin.
steps.description: Carefully fit each circle in, pressing the pastry into the curves and filling any cracks that may appear.

steps.headline: Add the jam.
steps.description: Place one teaspoonful of jam in to each tart.

steps.headline: Bake the tarts.
steps.description: Place the tarts in the oven for 13 to 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Add a topping of jam.
steps.description: Remove the tin from the oven and then immediately add another teaspoonful of jam to each tart, carefully mixing this with the cooked jam.

steps.headline: Allow to cool.
steps.description: Transfer the tarts to a cooling rack and serve.

Lay the pastry between two large layers of clingfilm and roll the pastry out to about 3mm thick. Cut out the tarts. Peel the top clingfilm and cut out as many tarts as you can with a circular pastry cutter. Add the dough to a tart tin. Carefully fit each circle in, pressing the pastry into the curves and filling any cracks that may appear. Add the jam. Place one teaspoonful of jam in to each tart. Bake the Tarts Bake the tarts. Place the tarts in the oven for 13 to 15 minutes. Add a topping of jam. Remove the tin from the oven and then immediately add another teaspoonful of jam to each tart, carefully mixing this with the cooked jam. Allow to cool. Transfer the tarts to a cooling rack and serve.
